intro: Youngia fusca, commonly known as the blackweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its small, dark purple flowers bloom in the summer, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Youngia fusca is often considered a weed but has ecological value in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for insects.
